meanings.definition: barricadoing: the act of constructing a barricade
meanings.sent1: The barricadoing of the fort walls was done by the soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The barricadoing of the street prevented cars from passing through.
meanings.sent3: The children's barricadoing of the sandcastle made it look like a fortress.
meanings.sent4: The barricadoing of emotions kept her feelings hidden from others.
meanings.sent5: The barricadoing of the entrance made it impossible to enter the building.

meanings.definition: barricadoing: to block or obstruct with a barricade
meanings.sent1: They were barricadoing the doors to keep the wild animals out.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were barricadoing the streets to make their voices heard.
meanings.sent3: She was barricadoing her room to keep her little brother out.
meanings.sent4: The storm was barricadoing the path with fallen trees.
meanings.sent5: The detective was barricadoing the crime scene to preserve evidence.
